fix_procedures.action: Power cycle the machine
Check diagnostic screen for additional error details
Contact machine manufacturer if error persists
Reduce feed override to 50% and retry
Check axis for mechanical binding — manually jog each axis slowly
Inspect servo motor cables for damage, loose connections
Check servo amplifier LEDs for fault codes
Measure motor insulation resistance (should be >1 MΩ)
Verify servo parameters match motor specs (Ke, Kt, inertia ratio)
Reduce cutting parameters — lower speed and/or feed rate
Check tool condition — replace dull or chipped tool
Verify spindle oil level and cooling system
Monitor spindle bearing temperature during test cut
Check spindle drive parameters and motor current waveform
Press reset and retry tool change
Open ATC cover and check for jammed tools
Clean tool change arm, gripper, and carousel fingers
Verify all ATC proximity sensors in diagnostics
Check ATC air pressure (typically 5-6 bar required)
Re-teach tool change positions if needed
Power cycle the machine
Check diagnostic screen for additional error details
Contact machine manufacturer if error persists
Release all emergency stop buttons (twist to release)
Check E-stop circuit continuity
Verify safety relay module status LEDs

Contact machine manufacturer if error persists

fix_procedures.safety_warning: Do NOT power off until batteries replaced to avoid position loss

fix_procedures.action: Verify absolute position is retained after battery replacement
If position lost, perform reference point return on all axes
